title: Educated Guess 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% whole-cluster pressed wine that is high-toned in flavors of lemon peel and grapefruit. The finish is quick and unfussy.

title: Forget-Brimont NV Brut Rosé Premier Cru  (Champagne)
description: This bottling has some age, giving its soft character some attractive bite and spice. The strawberry fruits are lively with a smooth character that comes from the relatively high dosage. Drink now.

title: Harken 2017 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (California)
description: Vivid toasted-oak aromas and flavors dominate this full-bodied mouth-filling wine. Along with a charred-wood aroma come buttery butterscotchy flavors from a complete malolactic fermentation and a pear nectar component that provides the fruity side.

title: Icardi 2015 Montubert  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals camphor, toasted oak and mocha aromas. The linear palate delivers raw cranberry, espresso and clove alongside taut rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Marquis de Goulaine 2017 La Loire Royale  (Vouvray)
description: This soft, medium-sweet Chenin Blanc offers crisp acidity, creamed apple and honey flavors and a clean aftertaste. Drink this light, perfumed wine now.

title: Michel Forget NV Premier Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This soft, ripe rosé has a tangy edge that keeps it bright and fruity. Strawberry flavors and a relatively high dosage means this is an easy wine to appreciate even when, as here, the bottling is young.

title: Navarro 2016 Navarrouge Red (Mendocino)
description: This good, easy-drinking wine gives a sweet first impression and builds fruity and savory notes through the flavors and finish. It adds chocolaty accents to herbal ones like bay leaf and fruity ones like black plum.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: Merlot and Cabernet Franc each make up 40% of this wine, with the balance being Cabernet Sauvignon. Clove, vanilla and raspberry roll-up aromas are followed by slightly dried-out fruit flavors. The tannins bring an astringent squeeze.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)
description: While demure on the nose, sweet grapefruit and pear notes in this semisweet white are forward and slightly confected on the palate. A blend of Kerner, Silvaner and Riesling, it's a sweet-tart, easy-drinking sip with just a hint of smoky minerality. Enjoy now.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Pintail Red (Napa Valley)
description: Thick tannins take on a leathery quality in this blend of 64% Zinfandel and 36% Cabernet Sauvignon, the Zin from high atop Howell Mountain. Tart acidity underlies the leather, black currant and dried herb.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2016 Aptus 6 Meses Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Sappy blackberry aromas are dense. In the mouth, this is heavy and a bit overweight for a joven-style wine. Plum and herbal flavors end with flabby weight.

title: Saddleback Cellars 2016 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a strong candied flavor of sugarcane and baked pineapple, allowing its ripeness and barrel-fermentation to speak loudly and with conviction.

title: Sand Point 2016 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Sweet oak aromas and candied fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine a pop personality. It has a soft texture, light tannins and quite a bit of vanilla and oak spices.

title: Sparkman 2016 Kindred Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of tin, green pepper, herb, plum and cherry lead to plump but still light fruit flavors. Grainy tannins provide support.

title: Washington Hills 2017 Late Harvest Riesling (Washington)
description: Honeysuckle, jasmine, lime and ripe peach aromas are followed by sweet fruit flavors, speckled with abundant floral notes. It delivers sweet, easy-drinking appeal.

title: Alasia 2014  Barbaresco
description: The shy nose eventually reveals moist underbrush and camphor aromas. The simple palate offers raw sour cherry and a hint of licorice framed in tight, somewhat astringent tannins.

title: Antis 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Hot tar and peanut brittle aromas are earthy at best. This Malbec is tight and unyielding on the palate, with plum and currant flavors. The finish tastes saucy, with tomatoey acidity.

title: Cantina della Serra 2016 Sessanta  (Erbaluce di Caluso)
description: Aromas of acacia and mature apricot follow over to the straightforward, rather evolved palate along with a balsamic note and a hint of candied orange slice. It closes on a bitter-almond note. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

title: Chakana 2017 Estate Selection Chardonnay (Uco Valley)
description: A bright gold color and aromas of pumpkin and melon lead to a chunky, plump palate. Flavors of squash and papaya are less than bright, while this softly peters out on the finish.

title: Coelho 2016 Coelho Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This plain and simple Pinot has light strawberry and thin raspberry fruit, with lemony acidity. It was whole berry fermented, but the overall impression is that the grapes either were picked early or simply ran out of ripening time.
